Contribution to {datacutr}

Source: vignettes/contribution_model.Rmd
contribution_model.Rmd

Introduction

This vignette gives you an overview of the anticipated contribution model. The goal is to enable users of {datacutr} to contribute and test the contribution model for {datacutr}. Adjustments might be made over time.

Basics

  • For each new contribution, the user creates an issue on the issue tab on GitHub to put it in our backlog.

  • All created issues will be reviewed within the next sprint and the creator will receive an initial feedback via a comment. Someone from the core development team will then triage new issues by assigning the appropriate labels (such as “user request” so we can easily identify new requests).

  • Issues are meant to be taken on by users from the Pharma programming community and not exclusively by the {datacutr} team from Roche.

Contribution Model

Type 1 Contribution with Code:

  • First, the user creates an issue or comments on an existing issue to notify that they’d like to contribute code.

  • Follow our development process step-by-step guide.

  • We advise to contact an {datacutr} core development team directly.

Type 2 Contribution without Code:

  • User creates an issue and ideally contacts an {datacutr} team member.

  • The {datacutr} core development team will contact the issue creator as soon as possible to discuss further details.

On this page
